Introduction¶

Welcome to the documentation for rpExtractSink. This project generates an sink file that is RetroPath2.0 friendly.

Usage¶

First build the rpBase and rpCache dockers before building the local docker:

docker build -t brsynth/rpextractsink-standalone:v2 .

To call the docker locally you can use the following command:

python run.py -input /path/to/file -output /path/to/file

API¶

class rpToolServe.main(input_sbml, output_sink, remove_dead_end, compartment_id)¶

Generate the sink from an SBML model

Parameters

  • input_sbml – The path to the SBML file

  • output_sink – The path to the output sink file

  • remove_dead_end – Remove the dead end species

  • compartment_id – The id of the SBML compartment to extract the sink from

  • input_sbml – str

  • output_sink – str

  • remove_dead_end – bool

  • compartment_id – str

Return type

None

Returns

None
